revised_title: The Osteology and Relationships of Clevosaurus: A Triassic Reptile
tldr: The author examines the osteology and relationships of Clevosaurus, a reptile from the late Triassic period. The study focuses on specimens from southwest Britain and provides insights into the taxonomy and morphology of this ancient reptile. Clevosaurus is found to have distinct characteristics that separate it from other lepidosauromorphs, making its position within the Sphenodontida unclear. The author suggests that Clevosaurus may share certain characteristics with other sphenodontid genera, forming a possible monophyletic assemblage.
